title: New ping
body: Maybe Riot can add an additional ping to the current pings. I was thinking like a "warded" ping That would help teammates know if a Bush is warded by an enemy.

replies.body: I actually really like this idea.  What do you all think about a "place a ward here" ping?  I feel like as a support player, I'd like to help my marksman know where we'd like more vision, but I feel like it might be too bossy. (also I'm in Silver, so it's a bit more of a thing at my division)

List of new pings you could add, making it a 8 parts Roulette instead of 4. 

-Warded here.

-Ward here.

-Group Up (the Assist me one is better/more often used to ask for lane cover, gank, objective control, etc.)

-Going in.

I agree with all of these. I would change the "Warded Here" to just "Warded", and keep the other as "Ward Here". I think separating them into one and two words helps with immediate visual recognition of which one is meant. I could easily see somebody seeing a ping for a split second and then looking away and not really noticing which one of the two was pinged.

Just an idea for clarity

Instead of going in you should put

-engage
***Yes please,this will make a better communication in Solo Q,specially.***
These are all really good pings. They would be relevant due to the fact that for each situation you wouldn't want to type the entire message out and ping a location.
I don't really know about the going in one because I just use the target ping, and group up I just use the regular ping and ping like 5 times. But the ward ones would be useful since I main adc lol.

Yes i'd agree with alllll of this. a warded and ward here ping would be a great addition to these. it may possibly help place a bit more encouragement for vision control. the only issues i see with this is that riot will have to create 2 more distinctive tones and icons for this, but it shouldnt be anything that they cannot handle
i like the going in ping a lot that would be useful for team fights and the bot and jungler
I don't think it's as useful as "Danger! Warded!" kind of ping. In low tiers, it definitely comes off as bossy, and in high tiers I don't think people need to be told where to ward.

>In low tiers, it definitely comes off as bossy

Who cares? We can't take time every game to type and explain how where wards are the less redundant/more efficient. They learn faster with bossy pings than nothing.
Also less text explanation usually means less flame if the person is prone to that behaviour.
Wow u really like my idea?! It just popped up in my mind.
It is a good idea.Help junglers and supports in general
You'll find a lot of people like this particular idea. We've been asking for it for a while now
I'd totally agree with that one. I always seem to need to remind the ADC to use their trinket. -_-
You are definitely not being too bossy.The new ping doesn't even have to be specific; it could be as generic as the "alert" ping. (ex:Ward) oh wait kitch26 just covered this

> I feel like as a support player, I'd like to help my marksman know where we'd like more vision, but I feel like it might be too bossy. (also I'm in Silver, so it's a bit more of a thing at my division)

Yes, it's very annoying to see my ADC wasting his/her trinket in the river bush  versus a jungler who can't dash in it over the wall, when I've drake and tribush covered. Especially if he/she whines about the bottom bush being in the dark afterwards.

There should be a different ping menu for 'v' ang 'g', one warning for wards, the other asking for one. Instead of 'danger', for example, which is more or less equivalent to bare 'v'.
I think the most important ping would be the "enemy ward" ping. Not only for tracking wards, but, e.g., to answer an "on my way" gank-ping with a warning that the river is warded.

Something that would be great with that "warded" ping would be the time of it. If you could, via ping, tell if its a 1, 2, 3 min ward or even a Pink.


Actually, I think there are lots of "pings" that are needed.
There are some suggestions already like the images attached, but i dont think even that would be enough.

Even though I didnt like Smite so much, I really enjoyed the Voice Guided System, which allows you to type a quick command (eg VG2 for "Gank mid lane", or VAT2 for "Attack mid tower").
This helps a lot dealing with toxic behaviour, since you can mute the toxic player and still communicate VERY well with this premade messages.


Hope you guys at riot give us players some feedback about this new pings, this is something we all want and need, especially for SoloQ.

This is purely from a tank's point of view, but can you guys maybe build a setting that would allow every 3 auto attacks or so on an enemy champ would then put a target ping over them? I only ask because I find it difficult to ping whilst pinning down carries to ping to my team that they must act. Maybe its silly, but I think it would be a helpful addition to the game.
